name: **American BBQ Avocado (No Cook)**
instructions: In a bowl, combine avocado with seasonings and olive oil.

Garnish with cilantro and serve.
notes: All measurements are for 2 servings. Salt and pepper to taste. Use proper broth type per protein/diet.

name: **American BBQ Bacon (Air Fryer)**
instructions: Preheat air fryer to 390°F.
Pat the bacon dry; toss with oil and seasonings to coat evenly.
Arrange in a single layer; air‑fry for 10 minutes, flipping halfway, until cooked through and edges are crisp.
Rest 2 minutes and serve with recommended sides.
notes: All measurements are for 2 servings. Salt and pepper to taste. Use proper broth type per protein/diet.

name: **Chinese-style Bacon (Grill)**
instructions: Marinate: In a bowl, whisk 1 tbsp olive oil with 2 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tsp fresh ginger, and 2 cloves garlic. Add bacon and refrigerate 30–60 minutes.
Preheat grill to medium‑high (375–400°F). Oil the grates.
Grill the bacon 4–6 minutes per side until cooked through.
Garnish with chives and serve.
notes: All measurements are for 2 servings. Salt and pepper to taste. Use proper broth type per protein/diet.

name: **Greek Bacon (Crockpot)**
instructions: Marinate: In a bowl, whisk 1 tbsp olive oil with 1 tsp oregano, and 1 tbsp lemon juice. Add bacon and refrigerate 30–60 minutes.
Place bacon in the slow cooker with spices and liquids.
Cook on LOW 6–8 hours (or HIGH half the time) until tender.
Garnish with chives and serve.
notes: All measurements are for 2 servings. Salt and pepper to taste. Use proper broth type per protein/diet.

name: **Japanese Bacon (Crockpot)**
instructions: Marinate: In a bowl, whisk 1 tbsp olive oil with 2 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp mirin, and 1 tsp fresh ginger. Add bacon and refrigerate 30–60 minutes.
Place bacon in the slow cooker with spices and liquids.
Cook on LOW 6–8 hours (or HIGH half the time) until tender.
Garnish with chives and serve.
notes: All measurements are for 2 servings. Salt and pepper to taste. Use proper broth type per protein/diet.

name: **Korean-style Bacon (Stove Top)**
instructions: Marinate: In a bowl, whisk 1 tbsp olive oil with 2 tbsp soy sauce, 2 tsp brown sugar, and 2 cloves garlic. Add bacon and refrigerate 30–60 minutes.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium‑high.
Sear the bacon 3–4 minutes per side until browned.
Add broth and simmer briefly to reduce and coat the ingredients.
Garnish with chives and serve.
notes: All measurements are for 2 servings. Salt and pepper to taste. Use proper broth type per protein/diet.

name: **Mexican Bacon (Oven Bake)**
instructions: Marinate: In a bowl, whisk 1 tbsp olive oil with 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp chili powder, and 1 tsp oregano. Add bacon and refrigerate 30–60 minutes.
Heat oven to 425°F. Line a sheet pan with parchment or foil.
Arrange bacon on the pan; roast until cooked through, flipping once if needed.
Add broth and simmer briefly to reduce and coat the ingredients.
Garnish with chives and serve.
notes: All measurements are for 2 servings. Salt and pepper to taste. Use proper broth type per protein/diet.

name: **Thai-style Bacon (Instant Pot)**
instructions: Marinate: In a bowl, whisk 1 tbsp olive oil with 1 cup coconut milk, 1 tsp red curry paste, and 1 tbsp lime juice. Add bacon and refrigerate 30–60 minutes.
Set Instant Pot to Sauté; warm a little oil.
Sear the bacon briefly; add liquids. Seal and pressure cook as directed.
Natural release 5 minutes, then quick release.
Garnish with chives and serve.
notes: All measurements are for 2 servings. Salt and pepper to taste. Use proper broth type per protein/diet.
